sentence: Technology shares were mainly higher in pre-market trade on Tuesday.

In technology stocks news, Giga-tronics ( GIGA ), a maker of instruments, subsystems and microwave components, saw its shares more than double in value in recent pre-market trade after saying it has struck a strategic software licensing deal with Lockheed Martin ( LMT ).
Shares in the company were 127.0% higher at $2.52 in recent pre-market trade, towards the upper end of the stock's 52 week trading range between $0.86 and $3.15.

Business solutions company Jive Software ( JIVE ) Tuesday said Conecteo, a customer relationship management ( CRM ) software vendor in France, has selected its Jive-x external community solution to help manage customer relations.
Shares in the company were flat at $5.02.
This is around the mid-point of the stock's 52 week trading range between $3.51 and $6.47.

And Rackspace Hosting, Inc ( RAX ), which operates in the managed cloud segment of the business information technology market, shares were upgraded to outperform from sector perform by RBC Capital Markets, with a price target set at $36.
The stock was 2.9% higher at $29.45 pre-bell.
This is towards the lower end of the company's 52 week trading range between $23.65 and $56.20.
